comment: Lectures could get boring but if you engage and he knows your name you'll do fine the rest of the semester. The test were homework questions with different numbers, and the final was the 4 unit test just with different numbers.
I failed this course, but I still love this professor very much. One of my favorite professors at KSU. Expect great things!

I was half the semester without knowing how was I doing in the class because he doesn't grade on time which is not fair. Doesn't know how to teach. Lectures are boring. Only good thing is the tests are just like the hw but still i didn't learn a single thing from him. If you actually wanna learn the subject just take someone else.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Lecture was pretty boring but he was a cool teacher and allows you to use a cheat sheet for the test, the test is an exact copy of the homework just different numbers. You can look up Quiz answers and homework was okay.

Took this class over the summer and we had 4 exams in which the lowest grade was dropped. Each exam was a word-for-word copy of the homework and recitation. He allows you to bring a cheat sheet so copy the homework questions on the sheet. Attendance is not mandatory.  Final exam is a word-for-word copy of previous exams. All quizzes are open note.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Bahri is a nice guy but his lectures are boring and do not fully corallate with the homework. The homework isnt too bad and the website he uses has help options for you. Tests are theory multiple choice and then the frq are some of the homework questions but different numbers. Overall, not a hard way to run the class, just bad lectures.
Despite slow lectures and taking awhile to grade things he is a pretty nice and attentive teacher. He gives plenty of opportunities to preform better in the class and is generally very nice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Bahri means well. He's a nice guy but is not the best at teaching. He would zoom through his slides which were just copied from the book. I practically taught myself through homework and e-book. The quizzes were open notes. The exams were ok, he allowed a cheat sheet. The final was not that bad at all if you studied.

Mostly ended up teaching myself. The professor means well, but I feel he's ineffective. Large slides of equations skipped past and hard to comprehend his explanations. I ended up learning through the homework (Master It and Watch It are your friends). Planned quizzes are based on the homework thankfully, but the pop quizzes are all conceptual...
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: As for the pros, he's a very nice and charming guy. If you showed you were interested in the topics, he would also show the enjoyment of teaching back to you. He remembered students' names that showed up to his breakouts too. Tests are modeled straight from the homework. As for the cons, he doesn't teach well, he has a hard time explaining concepts

Lectures are not helpful and go into detail about things that aren't on exams. Exams are just HW problems with different numbers, but there are pop quizzes: half of them are just shorter exams, half are 4 question online quizzes that take your second score as the final score but doesn't tell you what you got wrong. He does have a rubric for exams.

You will have to teach yourself. His lectures are useless but attendance is required. He takes three or more weeks to grade tests and quizzes take more than a month. Pop quizzes are a thing as well. Take anyone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Bahri is a good professor and knows what he is talking about, but he tends to tell you more than you need and does not really go over example problems into detail. Tests are pretty much over the hw so if you study most of the hw and the quizzes it will help. My suggestion is take him but if you can't teach yourself find another professor.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: This was his first time teaching lab, so he was slow to start. Through the semester, he showed himself to be very understanding and flexible even if you missed a lab or two. Its a easy A as long as you come to class and ask questions.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I had my doubts in the beginning once I became aware that his English was hard to understand, however, do not be worried. He is very personable and kind. He writes everything on the board one step at a time for easy understanding. Furthermore, if I had a question and spoke to him mono e mono he was great. Professor Bahri is a good lab teacher.
